intro: Psychotria razafimandimbisonii, commonly known as the Madagascar psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical rainforests of Madagascar, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and produces clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous tiny seeds, typical of the Rubiaceae family. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological role in its native habitat.
